ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with microcephaly, intellectual disability, and severe speech/language delays. Motor development is also typically affected. Age and severity of symptoms align well.
Presents with severe intellectual disability, microcephaly, absent or minimal speech, and motor delays. All four phenotypic features match well with this syndrome.
Characterized by intellectual disability, microcephaly, and developmental delays including speech and motor milestones. NIPBL gene mutations cause the most common form.
Primary microcephaly with intellectual disability is the hallmark. Speech and motor delays are common secondary features. Caused by MCPH1 mutations.
Features microcephaly, intellectual disability, and global developmental delays. Cholesterol biosynthesis defect affecting multiple systems including brain development.
Severe microcephaly with intellectual disability and developmental delays. Also known as bird-headed dwarfism. ATR gene mutations cause this subtype.
Intellectual disability with speech delays and motor developmental delays are typical. Microcephaly occurs in about 35% of cases. CREBBP mutations.
Characterized by intellectual disability, speech delays, and motor delays. Microcephaly is present in some cases. ARID1B mutations are most common.
